channel.title: Whats In The Box?
channel.description: Does anyone know anything about the video and site "Whats In The Box?" [url='https://www.whatsinthebox.nl/']https://www.whatsinthebox.nl/[/url], It seems to have stuff from Half Life 2 incoperated into it, The website really doesn't give anything more away, But after poking around I came across a website in the source code pointing to Babel Research [url='https://www.babel-research.eu/']https://www.babel-research.eu/[/url] - forgive me if im wrong but the logos at the bottom of the page look very much like Black Mesa & Appeture science, but I don't see were the Hanso Foundition fit's in (something to do with Lost). Any clues, or am I reading to much into this? , Sorry if this has been brought up before but I didn't see anything when I searched. Editied to include Babel Research website

item.title: Whats In The Box?
item.dc:creator: Zoose
item.description:
killowatt:

anyone notice when that hud thing pops up at the bottom there is a bunch of text going by well in some point you will see ‘‘black mesa’’ im not kidding this is gotta be HL2 related

No. It isn’t. The guy who created it already said it wasn’t.

also.

It’s cOLD[/SIZE] in here. Brr.

Read full topic

item.title: Whats In The Box?
item.dc:creator: Master_Chef
item.description:
Zoose:

No, it wasn’t. The people who made this were from Holland or Belgium I believe, while the people behind Escape from City 17 are clearly American.

Also, this is pretty old.

They were clearly Canuckers. Did you even visit their website?

item.title: Whats In The Box?
item.dc:creator: Imonfire
item.description:
Well, do you have the mp3? Yes? Then do this:

1.Go on this website: https://mediafire.com/
2.Click on Upload Files to Mediafire
3.Choose “I want to upload without and account”
4.Browse for your file and press “Open”
5.Click on Start Upload then “My Files”
6.Click on View my Uploaded Files, and then click on the file
7.Copy the url and then post it in here.

Read full topic

item.title: Whats In The Box?

item.description:
It’s already been revealed that it was done by some random dude who just wanted to try his abilities at post production effects. If you look on youtube there are interviews with the dude who made it…

item.title: Whats In The Box?
item.dc:creator: Level
item.description:
DansonDelta40:

Has anyone found out if the filmmaker has the official permission from valve to use half-life content? I saw an interview with him, and he didn’t ever say a word about being inspired by a game in it. It actually sounded like he claimed to have invented it all by himself. That’s what made me curious.

Nah, but as far as I know valve doesn’t care about reusing their assets elsewhere. Unlike Microsoft, where you have to get a license to use any sounds from Halo anywhere else.

He’s a half life enthusiast, but like I said before, no actual Valve canon or official affiliation.

Read full topic
